quoteCollection.quote: It is enough that the people know there was an election. The people who cast the votes decide nothing. The people who count the votes decide everything.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Stalin

quoteCollection.quote: If any foreign minister begins to defend to the death a 'peace conference', you can be sure his government has already placed its orders for new battleships and airplanes.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Stalin

quoteCollection.quote: Print is the sharpest and the strongest weapon of our party.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Stalin

quoteCollection.quote: The writer is the engineer of the human soul.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Stalin

quoteCollection.quote: Gratitude is a sickness suffered by dogs.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Stalin

quoteCollection.quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Campbell

quoteCollection.quote: I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Campbell

quoteCollection.quote: Computers are like Old Testament gods; lots of rules and no mercy.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Campbell

quoteCollection.quote: When you make the sacrifice in marriage, you're sacrificing not to each other but to unity in a relationship.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Campbell

quoteCollection.quote: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Campbell

quoteCollection.quote: Reading is a basic tool in the living of a good life.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Addison

quoteCollection.quote: There is no defense against criticism except obscurity.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Addison

quoteCollection.quote: A contented mind is the greatest blessing a man can enjoy in this world.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Addison

quoteCollection.quote: What sculpture is to a block of marble, education is to the soul.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Addison

quoteCollection.quote: A man should always consider how much he has more than he wants.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Addison

quoteCollection.quote: What I like about cities is that everything is king size, the beauty and the ugliness.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Brodsky

quoteCollection.quote: The surest defense against Evil is extreme individualism, originality of thinking, whimsicality, even-if you will-eccentricity. That is, something that can't be feigned, faked, imitated; something even a seasoned imposter couldn't be happy with.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Brodsky

quoteCollection.quote: It would be enough for me to have the system of a jury of twelve versus the system of one judge as a basis for preferring the U.S. to the Soviet Union. I would prefer the country you can leave to the country you cannot.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Brodsky

quoteCollection.quote: The poetic notion of infinity is far greater than that which is sponsored by any creed.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Brodsky

quoteCollection.quote: Death is the great adventure beside which moon landings and space trips pale into insignificance.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Bayly

quoteCollection.quote: Death always waits. The door of the hearse is never closed.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Bayly

quoteCollection.quote: Marriage is our last, best chance to grow up.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Barth

quoteCollection.quote: In the last analysis sound judgment will prevail.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Cannon

quoteCollection.quote: Sometimes in politics one must duel with skunks, but no one should be fool enough to allow skunks to choose the weapons.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Cannon

quoteCollection.quote: The day of small nations has long passed away. The day of Empires has come.
quoteCollection.author: Joseph Chamberlain
